page.title: 07LEISURE AND RECREATION
page.content: Renfrew is poorly equipped in terms of commercial entertainment. It has a disco, many pubs and restaurants and three snooker halls but no cinema, theatre or dance halls, amusement arcades or Sports Centre. Public facilities include the Robertson Park with a bowling green, swings and the "Cabin" a centre for the elderly. There are a number of sports available (see p17) including King George V playing fields and schools.The nearest sports centre is in Barrhead. There is a centre for the handicapped in Sandy Road. The churches run Youth Clubs with discos, Boys Brigade, Girl Guides Scouts, Women's Guilds etc. Renfrew High School, a Community School runs clubs and classes ranging from Karate to Dressmaking. The young people in Renfrew complain that there is nothing to do. Babcock Power run a Social Club
